title: 1/22/2024 Senate Committee on Judiciary
summary:
Overview:
The Georgia Senate Committee on Judiciary held a hearing on January 22, 2024 to consider House Bill 30, which codifies a definition of anti-Semitism based on the International Holocaust Remembrance Alliance (IHRA) definition. The session featured extensive debate and public testimony on the merits of the bill.

Key Actions:
**HB 30**: Bill to codify the IHRA definition of anti-Semitism in Georgia law.

Bills Introduced (First Reading):
No new bills were introduced.

Notable Moments:
- The committee chairman, Senator Strickland, set clear ground rules for public testimony, emphasizing respect and preventing intimidation.
- Senator Kennedy presented the bill, highlighting the need for a clear definition to address the rise in anti-Semitic incidents in Georgia.
- Senator Kennedy noted that the bill has the support of 90-95% of Jewish groups, while some opposing groups are considered anti-Semitic hate groups.
- Extensive public testimony was heard both in favor and against the bill.

Votes:
No recorded votes were taken.

Attendance:
The committee maintained a quorum throughout the session.

Adjournment:
The committee hearing adjourned. No next session date was provided.
